alert.note: Alert for Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 3:20PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Fremont County through 400 PM MDT... At 318 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Royal Gorge, or 20 miles northeast of Hayden Pass Burn Scar, moving northwest at 15 mph. We are also concerned of heavy rain potentially knocking any debris on Highway 50 through the eastern portions of Bighorn Sheep Canyon. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Fremont County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft
